title.narrative: Building Preparedness of Vulnerable Communities, in Nepal and Bangladesh, through inclusive disaster risk reduction initiatives.

description.narrative: 4010 older women and men and their families (16,040 people) in Bangladesh and Nepal have built disaster prepared livelihoods in order to lessen the immediate impact of disasters.

A total of 560 humanitarian staff (180 from Bangladesh and 380 from Nepal, from I/NGOs, UN agencies, government, and donors) have improved knowledge and strengthened capacity on age inclusive humanitarian response by November 2018.

Building Preparedness of Vulnerable Communities, in Nepal and Bangladesh, through inclusive disaster risk reduction initiative - this is the second phase. This project is to contribute to preparing communities to better withstand reoccurring natural disasters. The project will build on learning from the existing project to focus on basic disaster preparedness techniques as well as encouraging community structures and livelihoods which contribute to building disaster ready communities. In doing so communities will be able to better anticipate, respond to and recover from the negative impact of recurrent natural hazards
Improved data on gender, age and disasters is available and learning is shared on a regular basis within HelpAge and its network.
Regional emergency fund (REF) is provisioned to respond in a quick and timely manner to meet the older people needs in any disasters during project period.

a total of 104 local communities represented by 80 community disaster management committees (CDMCs) in Bangladesh, and 24 Older People Associations in Nepal as well as 8 union disaster management committees (UDMC) in Bangladesh and 6 local disaster risk management committees (LDRMC) in Nepal have improved capacity and knowledge to assess and plan for risk reduction and mitigation, and better preparedness to respond quickly to local level natural disasters faced by up to 11,281 older women and men and their families - up to 43,692 in Bangladesh and Nepal.
